sentences.sContent: They slit open the organisms and suck out the cytoplasm.
sentences.sContent_eng: They slit open the organisms and suck out the cytoplasm.
sentences.sCn: 它们撕开海藻那单细胞的机体，将细胞质吸出来。

sentences.sContent: Most of the cytoplasm has been squeezed out in order to make the sperm an efficient torpedo-like swimming machine.
sentences.sContent_eng: Most of the cytoplasm has been squeezed out in order to make the sperm an efficient torpedo-like swimming machine.
sentences.sCn: 大多数细胞质被挤出，为了让精子成为一个高效率的鱼类状游泳机器。

sentences.sContent: IVF often fails in older women because there are abnormalities in the outside of their eggs, known as cytoplasm, which surrounds the nucleus.
sentences.sContent_eng: IVF often fails in older women because there are abnormalities in the outside of their eggs, known as cytoplasm, which surrounds the nucleus.
sentences.sCn: 因为在老年妇女的卵子外部，包围着细胞核的细胞质会畸变，所以她们接受试管受精常以失败告终。

words.tran: 胞体质的；细胞质的（等于cytoplasm）

trans.tranOther: all the material in the cell of a living thing except the  nucleus (= central part )
